ja36:1.1: Noticing a fire starting in the tree under which they shelter, the Bodhisatta tries to warn the flock, but the foolish birds dismissed him, “for he is always seeing crocodiles in a drop of water”. | “Evergreen” (jagatirūha, “earth-grower”) is a poetic term for a tree.
ja36:1.3: Vakkaṅga, in Sanskrit variously spelled vakrāṅga or cakrāṅga is the cakravāka or Brahminy goose. It is named for its curved neck.
